name: Puffinfolk
movement: walk 20 ft., swim 30 ft., fly 40 ft.
description: The Puffinfolk is a small humanoid known for its exceptional agility in marine environments, equipped with leather armor and capable of swimming and flying easily.
memorable: Their ability to navigate and evade in water and air, along with the unique 'Blessings of the Sea Gods' ability, makes them uniquely adaptable in combat.
goals: They often explore oceanic environments, using their skills to survive and navigate effectively.
relations: Related to other aquatic humanoids, they may encounter merfolk or sea elves.
environment: Primarily found in marine environments, including coastal regions and oceanic waters.
strengths: Exceptional Dexterity allows them to avoid attacks and succeed in nimble maneuvers.
weaknesses: Lower hit points limit their endurance in prolonged combat; average Charisma affects social interactions.
attacks: Peck attack with +6 to hit, dealing 7 piercing damage, showcasing their combat capability.
most_powerful_ability: Quick and Nimble grants them a defensive advantage, allowing them to impose disadvantage on attack rolls targeting them.
equipment: Leather armor provides a base level of protection.
senses: Possesses darkvision that enables them to see in dim light as if it were bright light.
skills: Skilled in Perception, allowing them to effectively notice details and dangers.
additional_information: Can hold their breath for 30 minutes underwater.
Perfectly recalls paths traveled in oceanic environments.
Advantage on saving throws while swimming or flying over ocean waters.
Considered a Medium creature when determining carrying capacity.
Agile and capable of evading attacks more easily.
test_queries: marine creature that can hold its breath
monster with peck attack and evasive skills
creature that excels in aquatic environments
